editation for mental and spiritual well-being
Meditation is a practice that involves mind and body. It originated in ancient 
times as a part of religious and spiritual practice. Meditation relaxes the mind 
and therefore, can be beneficial in reducing mental stress. There are many types 
of meditation techniques andamong the most popular are Yoga meditation, mindfulness meditation and transcendental meditation –to name just a few. 
Yogic meditation involves ethical practices, stabilisation of body, breath control, 
withdrawal of senses from external senses and concentration. In mindfulness 
meditation, a common practice is to focus attention on a bodily function such as 
breathing – inhalation and exhalation – so that other thoughts are blocked from 
entering into the mind. In transcendental meditation, one focuses on a word or 
phrase in the mind, or a sound that one hears. The result achieved, thereby, is 
similar as in mindfulness meditation.
